intro: Chaerophyllum sylvestre var. ateanum, commonly known as the Greater Wall-rocket, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodlands or along stream banks. Its leaves are aromatic and have been historically used in traditional medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. The species is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
